snippet: The State Senate gave final approval on Thursday to a measure that would exempt doctors from criminal or civil liability when treating terminally ill patients who choose to end their lives.
abstract: Vermont State Senate gives final approval to measure that would exempt doctors from criminal or civil liability when treating terminally ill patients who choose to end their lives.
lead_paragraph: The State Senate gave final approval on Thursday to a measure that would exempt doctors from criminal or civil liability when treating terminally ill patients who choose to end their lives.

headline.main: Vermont: Senate Advances Bill for Cases in Which Patients Choose to End Lives
headline.print_headline: Vermont: Senate Advances Bill For Cases In Which Patients Choose To End Lives
